definition: to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
deceitful in many ways (idiom); wily and mischievous/full of craft and cunning

sentences.english: One cannot overlook his uncanny ability to navigate the many political intrigues and maneuverings.
sentences.chinese: 沒人能忽略他平息各種政治陰謀詭計的稟賦。

sentences.english: Wanting to do him dirt, she sent his wife a poison-pen letter.
sentences.chinese: 施詭計就寫了一封惡意中傷的信給他的妻子。

sentences.english: If Satan can't defeat us by a frontal attack, he will do it in a more subtle way.
sentences.chinese: 撒但若不能正面攻擊我們，就會改用更巧妙的詭計。

sentences.english: The inspectors soon saw through his scheme to avoid paying income tax.
sentences.chinese: 稽查員一眼就看穿了他企圖逃避繳納所得的詭計。

sentences.english: Such machinations will likely only get worse.
sentences.chinese: 而使用陰謀詭計只能讓事情變得更糟。

sentences.english: He was intrigued out of power.
sentences.chinese: 他被人施詭計搞下了臺。

sentences.english: Many feel it will need all the wiles of the geisha to preserve its success.
sentences.chinese: 許多人感覺利用藝伎只不過是保存實力的詭計。

sentences.english: For it is written, He taketh the wise in their own craftiness.
sentences.chinese: 如經上記着說，主叫有智慧的中了自己的詭計。

sentences.english: These shenanigans naturally made creditors unwilling to lend to governments.
sentences.chinese: 這些詭計自然讓債權人不願借錢給政府。

sentences.english: You're a scheming little devil, aren't you?
sentences.chinese: 你是個耍陰謀詭計的小魔鬼，對不對？
他是詭計多端的老狐狸。

sentences.english: Whatever its reasons, Google’s shenanigans did not work.
sentences.chinese: 無論其原因，谷歌的詭計並不起效。

sentences.english: They arehearersof their Origin, but not servants of machination.
sentences.chinese: 人是自身本源的傾聽者，然而並非是詭計者的僕人。
你的詭計已暴露無遺了。

sentences.english: These players have to survive on their wiles.
sentences.chinese: 這些運動員得靠詭計才能不被淘汰。

sentences.english: Depressingly, these market-distorting shenanigans are part of a pattern.
sentences.chinese: 令人沮喪的是，這些扭曲市場的詭計成了潛規則。

definition: lit. to quote the classics/to quote chapter and verse (idiom)
to sensationalize (idiom); deliberate exaggeration to scare people
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
